I have a feeling that somebody out there has some good information on
this... So before I go and start modifying code...

 

Is the result state of "Skipped" a good idea?

 

The reason I'm asking... I think I've improved upon JUnitExt's
Prerequisite annotation.  However, I've run into the case where all
tests are filtered out.  Thus, I'd like to add a "Skipped" state.

 

Anyone have any feelings about this?

 

Big Mike

 

Mike Forsberg

Factory Automation Engineer II

T (512) 602-0220
